block.l: // const iframe_container_id = `snap_iframe_container_${id}`; // const iframe_id = `snap_iframe_${id}`; if (document.getElementById(iframe_container_id)) { return } // ÂÆπÂô®: ÊéßÂà∂Â∞∫ÂØ∏Âíå‰ΩçÁΩÆ, resizable, draggable let iframe_container = document.createElement('div'); iframe_container.id = iframe_container_id; iframe_container.style.left = "780px"; iframe_container.style.top = "20px" iframe_container.style.width = '480px'; iframe_container.style.height = '360px'; iframe_container.style.padding = '0.8em'; iframe_container.className = 'ui-widget-content'; // ÂàõÂª∫ <button> ÂÖÉÁ¥† let close_button = document.createElement('button'); close_button.id = "close-iframe-resizable"; close_button.className = 'btn btn-x top-left'; close_button.textContent = 'x'; // ÂàõÂª∫ <iframe> ÂÖÉÁ¥† let iframe = document.createElement('iframe'); iframe.allow="geolocation; microphone; camera; bluetooth; serial"; iframe.src = url; iframe.className = 'ui-widget-content'; iframe.id = iframe_id; iframe.style.width = '100%'; iframe.style.height = '100%'; iframe_container.appendChild(close_button); iframe_container.appendChild(iframe); document.body.appendChild(iframe_container); $("#"+iframe_container_id).resizable({ helper: "ui-resizable-helper" }).draggable();; close_button.onclick = () => { // const div = document.getElementById("iframe_container"); iframe_container.style.display = "none"; }

block-definition.s: ü™ü set id %'id' width %'width' height %'height' left %'left' top %'top'

block.l: // const iframe_container_id = `snap_iframe_container_${id}`; let iframe_container = document.getElementById(iframe_container_id); if (iframe_container){ iframe_container.style.width = width; iframe_container.style.height = height; iframe_container.style.left = left; iframe_container.style.top = top; }
// const iframe_id = `snap_iframe_${id}`; let iframe = document.getElementById(iframe_id); if (iframe){ iframe.contentWindow.postMessage(msg, '*'); }

// add jqueryui css let jqueryui_url = 'https://code.jquery.com/ui/1.13.3/themes/base/jquery-ui.css'; let linkExists = document.querySelector(`link[href="${jqueryui_url}"]`); if (linkExists) {return} let link = document.createElement('link'); link.rel = 'stylesheet'; link.href = jqueryui_url; document.head.appendChild(link); // create ui-resizable-helper var style = document.createElement('style'); style.type = 'text/css'; var css = ` #resizable { width: 150px; height: 150px; padding: 0.5em; } .ui-resizable-helper { border: 20px solid #EFEFEF; margin: -20px; } `; style.appendChild(document.createTextNode(css)); document.head.appendChild(style);

let that = this; function run_callback(callback, args) { let stage = that.parentThatIsA(StageMorph); let proc = new Process(); // let args = args; proc.initializeFor(callback, new List(args)); stage.threads.processes.push(proc); } if (window._handlePostMessage){ window.removeEventListener('message', window._handlePostMessage); } window._handlePostMessage = (event) => { console.log('Received message from iframe:', event.data); run_callback(callback, [event.data]); } window.addEventListener('message', window._handlePostMessage);

block-definition.comment: Connect to a broker The options are not required but can be filled if needed 1. username (some brokers need this) 2. password (some brokers need this) 3. keepalive (default time is 60 seconds but some brokers need a shorter time) 4. connection callback (ringed set of scripts to be run when connection is made or remade) Note: The connection callback doesn''t have to be the 4th option - it just has to be the last (or only) option. ADVANCED: The brokers offered in the menu are accessed using default ports and basepaths (if needed). If accessing other brokers, the complete urls should be formed like this: siteURL:port/basepath e.g mqtt.eclipseprojects.io:443/mqtt It is possible to have more than one connection to the same broker, for instance, using two different user/pass accounts simultaneously. To do this, add a connection id at the end of the broker: e.g mqtt.eclipseprojects.io:443/mqtt|1
Publish a message to an MQTT broker The options are not required but can be filled if needed 1. qos (quality of service 0,1 or 2) 2. retain flag (boolean)

block-definition.s: $cloudOutline MQTT subscribe to %'broker' topic %'topic' $nl on each message run %'callback' $nl $options-1-192-192-192 %'options'
block-definition.comment: Subscribe to a topic on a broker Make sure you have already run an MQTT connect block before using this one You should add a script to be run inside he grey ring. It will be run each time a message is received If you click on the arrow on the grey ring twice, you can use #1 and #2 inside your script. #1 will contain the received payload #2 will contain the received topic name The options are not required but can be filled if needed There is only 1 option at present 1. Binary mode (boolean) If true, payload returned as plain binary byte string. Default condition (false) it is returned as UTF text string

Catch errors. Runs the first script. If it succeeds, nothing else happens. But if it has an error (something that would otherwise result in a red halo around the block), then the second script is run, with the text of the error message that would have been shown in the variable ERROR.
block-definition.translations: pt:tenta executar _ e, em caso de erro _ , executa _ ca:prova de forma segura _ i si _ _

block.l: let that = this; function run_callback(callback, args) { let stage = that.parentThatIsA(StageMorph); let proc = new Process(); // let args = args; proc.initializeFor(callback, new List(args)); stage.threads.processes.push(proc); } if (window._handlePostMessage){ return // window.removeEventListener('message', window._handlePostMessage); } window._handlePostMessage = (event) => { console.log('Received message from iframe:', event.data); run_callback(callback, [event.data]); } window.addEventListener('message', window._handlePostMessage);
